From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: correspondré

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin correspondēre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ku.rəsˈpɔn.dɾə]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ko.rəsˈpɔn.dɾə]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [ko.resˈpɔn.dɾe]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

correspondre (first-person singular present corresponc, first-person singular preterite corresponguí, past participle correspost); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /ɔ/

  1. to correspond

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of correspondre (second conjugation, irregular, with velar infix)
infinitive correspondre
gerund corresponent
past participle masculine feminine
singular correspost corresposta
plural corresposts, correspostos correspostes
person singular plural
first second third first second third

nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles

future correspondré correspondràs correspondrà correspondrem correspondreu correspondran
preterite corresponguí correspongueres correspongué corresponguérem corresponguéreu correspongueren
conditional correspondria correspondries correspondria correspondríem correspondríeu correspondrien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres

vostès

negative (no) — no corresponguis no correspongui no corresponguem no correspongueu no corresponguin

Related terms

[edit]
  • correspondència
  • correspondent

Further reading

[edit]
  • “correspondre”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “correspondre”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “correspondre” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “correspondre” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Medieval Latin correspondēre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kɔ.ʁɛs.pɔ̃dʁ/
  • Audio (Paris):(file)
  • Audio (Canada (Shawinigan)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Toulouse)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

correspondre

  1. to correspond
    Le Québec est une province du Canada dont les frontières correspondent au territoire de la nation québécoise.
    Quebec is a province of Canada whose borders correspond to the territory of the Quebecois nation.
  2. to write to

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of correspondre (see also Appendix:French verbs)

compound avoir + past participle
present participle or gerund1 simple correspondant

compound — simple imperative of avoir + past participle — simple imperative of avoir + past participle simple imperative of avoir + past participle —
1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Related terms

[edit]
  • correspondance
  • correspondant

Further reading

[edit]
  • “correspondre”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Middle French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Medieval Latin correspondēre.

Verb

[edit]

correspondre

  1. to correspond (of two or more people, to mutually respond to one another)

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

First known attestation circa 1330, from Medieval Latin correspondēre.

Verb

[edit]

correspondre

  1. to correspond
  2. to write to

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a third-group verb. This verb has irregularities in its conjugation. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of correspondre (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive correspondre avoir correspondu, correspons
gerund en correspondant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle correspondant
past participle correspondu, correspons
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present correspoing, correspon corresponz correspont correspondons correspondez correspondent
imperfect correspondoie, correspondeie correspondoies, correspondeies correspondoit, correspondeit correspondiiens, correspondiens correspondiiez, correspondiez correspondoient, correspondeient
preterite correspondi correspondis correspondié, correspost correspondimes correspondistes correspondierent
future correspondrai correspondras correspondra correspondrons correspondroiz, correspondreiz, correspondrez correspondront
conditional correspondroie, correspondreie correspondroies, correspondreies correspondroit, correspondreit correspondriiens, correspondriens correspondriiez, correspondriez correspondroient, correspondreient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
past anterior preterite tense of avoir + past participle
future perfect future tense of avoir + past participle
conditional perfect conditional tense of avoir + past participle
subjunctive que jo que tu qu’il que nos que vos qu’il
simple
tenses 		present correspoigne, corresponde correspoignes, correspondes correspoigne, corresponde correspoignons, correspondons correspoignez, correspondez correspoignent, correspondent
imperfect correspondisse correspondisses correspondist correspondissons, correspondissiens correspondissoiz, correspondissez, correspondissiez correspondissent
compound
tenses 		past present subjunctive of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect subjunctive of avoir + past participle
imperative – tu – nos vos –
— correspont — correspondons correspondez —
